name: New Orleans Marriott

reviews.title: Horrible
reviews.text: One of the most horrible parts about the hotel were the elevators. Whoever thought that giving the elevators a "brain" was totally wrong. Many time when we were in a rush with our group, we were forced to take the stairs. We waited for 15 minutes for the elevator to arrive because when we punched the numbers into the supposedly smart elevator, it would give us question marks. After waiting for too long and for almost being late for our bus departure, we resorted to walking down 17 floors with our equipment. When we arrived back at the hotel after the sugar bowl, chaos ensued and we were forced to walk up to the 17th floor because we needed to retrieve things from the room that needed to be shipped out.

reviews.title: Awful Service and Reservations Are Useless
reviews.text: The second part was the service. The service at the Marriott was terrible. We had to ask 3 times for toilet paper. Each time we were met with very rude and short tempered "service" personnel. We had to resort to using the Kleanex and then borrowing some from a neighboring room before the toilet paper arrived.

reviews.title: Cramped Quarters, Nice Location
reviews.text: All in all this hotel has horrible service and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.title: If you're claustrophobic I wouldn't recommend it
reviews.text: NEVER NEVER NEVER make reservations at this hotel for New Years Eve/Day or any other big event... ever... reservations are totally useless.

reviews.title: Terrible stay, items stolen, staff unhelpful
reviews.text: We made reservations for two rooms for New Years Eve months and months ago. We arrive at 3:00 pm (which is every hotels normal check-in time) and they say that they've overbooked and are moving us to the Residence Inn in the Warehouse District. Actually, they lied and said they were moving us a few blocks down from where we were and when we got there (after getting lost without the help of the pathetic map they gave us) we realized that it was in the warehouse district. For those of you that are not familiar with New Orleans, this is nowhere near the French Quarter or "Arnauds" the restaurant where we had reservations (made three months ago). This was after calling at 12:00 pm to ask if any rooms were already cleaned so that we could check-in early and they told us that no rooms were clean and to come later in the day. They didn't even bother telling us that we didn't have rooms there anyway.

reviews.title: Good for Business travelers, not for individuals
reviews.text: Maybe I'm crazy, but charging $25.00 per night for inconvenient valet parking is a ripoff. If you are a business traveler, you probably won't care because you don't have to pay for it (your company will, however). For average Joe's like me, it's a lot of money. They hold your car hostage and you have to wait an hour in line just to get your own car back. Hotel ammenities were average, rooms were average, pillows gave me a headache, but the view of the river was nice. Most of the staff were friendly.

reviews.title: Treated like Royalty
reviews.text: My friends and I recently enjoyed our stay at the New Orleans Marriott.(9/30-10/3/2004) We had secured the reservation thru Priceline but my friend then called and asked about rollaways. The reservation clerk suggested a King size room with 2 rollaways and we were set. Upon arrival, the front desk did not have the information but when advised what we were told gave us 2905 a beautiful king suite with 2 rollaways. It started our jaunt in high fashion. Everyone from the front desk, to the conceirge to the parking valets were helpful and FRIENDLY! The hotel is beautiful and so convenient to the Quarter or to the streetcars. It was a wonderful home base for our adventure!

reviews.title: Good experience at Mariott N.O.
reviews.text: Attended a conference here Oct '04. Hotel location is perfect - close to the action but not the noise, and no car needed. Service was good. Food (even convention food) was good. Exercise room, outdoor pool, coin laundry on site - very convenient. I would stay here again.

Upon arrival I had one problem with the room, which was immediately and personally resolved by Virginia Cruel, head of Housekeeping. She even sent a goodie basket for the inconvenience and gave me a tour of a sample redecorated room - the whole hotel will be rennovated starting Nov '04 and will be beautiful. I will recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
Got for what i paid for.....
reviews.text: We stayed here 09/02/2004 to 09/05/2004 to visit friends in New Orleans. The location is great for seeing the sites, especially the French Quarter, a block away.

reviews.title: Small rooms, but otherwise a positive experience
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated close to Bourbon St., the Convention Center, Harrahs Casino and the French Market.

reviews.title: Very Happy With hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are on the very small side (the bathrooms even smaller), but they are clean and nicely decorated.

reviews.title: Great front desk & bellmen; some lapses in housekeeping
reviews.text: My biggest complaint was the elevators. They use a control system where you enter your floor number and then the system directs you to the elevator you need to use to get to your floor. You're better off taking the stairs if you need to be somewhere fast. I waited 10 minutes just to reach the lobby.

reviews.title: Overbooking Seems To Be The Rule Of Thumb At This Hotel!
reviews.text: Other than the elevators, everything was fine.

reviews.title: Horrible Hotel
reviews.text: Let me preface my remarks with the note that I am a meeting planner and was attending a National Board of Directors meeting of my professional meeting planners organization. I'm sure my profile indicated this status. The hotel was lovely and the service personnel I encountered were very helpful. My only concern was that when I checked in I was given a room on a floor where active construction work putting in new windows was occurring and I had to deal with loud construction workers talking back and forth, the construction refuse bins in the hall and the loud machinery. I went downstairs and requested another room and was immediately moved to a very nice room far away from the construction.. I think the front desk staff should not put people on floors with active construction. I was fascinated by the elevators and there were several big conventions at the hotel at the same time and elevator traffic seemed to move very smoothly.

reviews.title: super comfortable, wonderfully located, GREAT!
reviews.text: i booked this hotel through priceline for an amazing rate, and had a WONDERFUL stay the past several days. (jan 10-13)

reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location!!
reviews.text: the only slight problem was upon checkin: had called several times to request and confirm a king size bed in the week leading up to our arrival.. but the room i was given was a double. however, it was switched with no hassle, very quickly & politely, & our new room was also a switch over to the river tower!!

reviews.title: Standard Room, Excellent Buffet
reviews.text: bed was amazing -- pillows the most comfortable i've ever slept on, even better than the pillows i sleep on at home. the size of the room was at a minimum, but did not feel too small.
room service was delicious, took a whole hour to arrive as opposed to the 30 min. time i was told, but no matter -- the friendliness of the staff who delivered it made up for it!
reviews.title: Okay but nothing to remember!
Great View of the Mississippi
reviews.text: every single staff member i encountered during my stay was polite, efficient, professional, and helpful. each and every one! even the maids. it was such a relief, in contrast to the other hotel experiences i have had in new orleans.

I used to live in NOLA, so this was my first time to travel there as a touist. It was fun to stay in the quarter. This was a nice hotel and I recommend to anyone, however next time I'm there, I'll probably look for a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: I have been to NO several times, but this was my first stay at Marriott. The location was sooo convenient to the Riverwalk, Harrah's, Bourbon Street, and Jackson Square. Literally in the middle of everything!
reviews.title: Great for New Orleans!
Great St Patrick's Day Stay
reviews.text: The lobby to this hotel is gorgeous, and the staff were above and beyond friendly. I requested the River Tower, and they happily accomodated, even volunteering to find us the room with the best view of the river. Upon checkout, we used the Baggage room to store bags while we did more touring, and that was also handled seamlessly.

reviews.title: Newly remodeled room
reviews.text: The apparently newly decorated rooms included beds that were really gorgeous with lots of pillows, etc, and were extremely soft (although after 3 nights the cushiness was getting hard on my back!). Are the rooms smaller than 4 stars in other cities? Yep! Are the bathrooms smaller? Yep! Just like almost everything in New Orleans this is an older hotel with smaller rooms, but they do a wonderful job of making things homey, convenient, clean, and pretty. Really, after all, who goes to New Orleans to spend a lot of time in the rooms??

Also, in response to other posters who had bad experiences due to booking through a discount website, I too booked through Priceline, and this was not brought up once during our stay, nor did I feel like I got sub-par treatment due to this.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: I stayed at the NO Marriott beginning of March for 5 nights, attending a conference. The location is great (within walking distance to French Quarters, riverfront, Faubourg Marigny, etc) but not noisy at all. However, the room was small (1 king bed and there was very little room left in the room). Ventilation was a problem - the room felt damp even with the AC on full blast. We had to pay close to $10 a day for high speed internet, or, separately if in the lobby, for wireless internet, the connection for which was unreliable at best. Housekeeping was not great either - we found our ice bucket not dumped out or the glasses not cleaned or replaced. There was no water in all of the hotel during one of the days we stayed (for about 6 hours). For the price we paid which was the conference rate (supposedly better than rack rate), we'd expect more.
reviews.title: okay if you booked through a discount website...
Overpriced
reviews.text: Small rooms, in desparate need of a renovation for these rates.

Had a good stay here for the last weekend of Mardi Gras. The front desk staff and other staff members I came in contact with were all friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent and is especially so during Mardi Gras because it is on the French Quarter side of Canal St., which eliminates the problem of trying to cross Canal St. when the parades are rolling. The hotel restaurant, gift shop, lobby bar and Canal St. bar are really convenient during inclimate weather or when you just don't feel like leaving the hotel. The room was your standard size room and everything was in working order. However, the beds were somewhat strange to sleep on as the mattress had a tendency to slide on the boxspring if you moved too much. I didn't have any problems sleeping on the bed, but I woke up a couple of times with part of the mattress hanging over the boxspring. Overall, I really liked my stay here and would definitely stay here again if the price is reasonable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Greatness!
reviews.text: My friends and I were able to book a one night stay a week before Mardi Gras. I did not think we would even get double beds. I was so pleasantly surprised that we were able to check in before 3:00pm and still get double beds in a non-smoking room. The room was clean with a great view. The location was unbelievable and close to everything. Definately worth the price!

reviews.title: Poor housekeeping
reviews.text: This hotel has a good location, and the rooms are quiet and well equipped. But housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired.

reviews.title: Great Stay
reviews.text: The Marriott in NO was a great stay. The location was conveniently located near places such as the casino, Bourbon St and Preservation Hall. Being on the main road, it was very easy to take the cable cars and hail a taxi to the airport. Since it was the off-season, we got a great rate which made the stay worth the cost.

reviews.title: There are better deals in NOLA
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and impressive, but did lack "local" charm. Since the goal of a trip is to spend more time outside of the room than in, this might not be an issue to most people. The bed was comfortable and the sheets and comforter were soft.

reviews.title: Great Room, Great View
reviews.text: The hotel lobby was renovated this summer and was very attractive. Although we never ate at the 4 restaurants in the hotel, they seemed to be priced on par with the rest of the city.

reviews.title: The Best of the Best
reviews.text: I attended a conference at this hotel. The room rates were outrageous, there was no business support, $15 internet per day plus 190$ a room??? Impersonal service and a subpar restaraunt with no included breakfast. I was also informed at the conference that they couldn't print out an extra schedule from the internet since the hotel wouldn't give the conference internet access even though we paid outrageous amounts to host it there (they also printed signs that they posted all over the hotel, the bar, etc, with the wrong name of our organization)- all of this make no sense in a city that prides itself on service and hospitality.

reviews.title: Good experience here!
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay for the Voodoo Music Experience. The concert rate was very affordable, and the room was large, clean and had a great view of Cannal Street. Would definitely stay there again.

Located on the French Quarter side of Canal Street. Although it was on the border of the Quarter, it was perfect for walking to all the French Quarter sites. The rate was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good bet for the French Quarter

reviews.text: Some bummers included: Confusing elevators, expensive parking ($30/day), costly internet ($15/day), pool closed for repair, advertised day care was not available when we wanted it.
reviews.title: Marriott New Orleans-beautiful hotel with excellent location!

likes.liked: — location and safety of walking distance to everything

reviews.text: The front desk staff, bell hops, restaurant staff, and parking attendants were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pleased

reviews.text: The rooms had great linens on the beds. The rooms looked great.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: My group consisted of 4 women under the age of 35, so above all, we wanted a hotel that was safe and close to everything-and the Marriott New Orleans exceeded all of our expectations!! Located on busy Canal st. just two very short blocks to Bourbon, we felt safe stumbling back to the hotel at 4 in the morning after too many Hurricane's at Pat O'Brien's-the streets were well lit and safe. The hotel itself was undergoing construction in the lobby, but it really didn't interfere with our stay. Our room was exceptionally clean, with the most amazing beds any of us have ever slept in-so comfortable! The staff were very accommodating and let us have a later check-out (without charge) since our flight was a little later in the day-very appreciated. Also, this hotel is a typical high-rise, luxury hotel, so if you are expecting to get old style New Orleans accommodations, this is not the hotel to pick, but it was definitely the one for us-and if the rates are good, it will always be the hotel we choose while staying in the beautiful city of New Orleans.
reviews.title: Wont visit again

likes.disliked: — Too crowded and guests staying there were not very desirable people

aka: New Orleans Marriott Hotel New Orleans
